meanings.definition: Large flightless bird native to Australia and New Guinea.
meanings.sent1: Cassowaries are big birds that cannot fly.
meanings.sent2: People in Australia and New Guinea often see cassowaries in the wild.
meanings.sent3: The cassowaries decided to have a race to see who could run the fastest.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the cassowaries moved gracefully like shadows on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The colorful feathers of the cassowaries make them stand out in the dense jungle.

meanings.sent1: Look at all those cassowaries roaming around the zoo!
meanings.sent2: The guide pointed out the cassowaries to the excited children.
meanings.sent3: The cassowaries gathered for a group photo, but they all looked the same.
meanings.sent4: The field was filled with cassowaries, a sea of feathers and beaks.
meanings.sent5: The cassowaries' loud calls echoed through the valley, a chorus of unique voices.
